I just realized this is a bunch of text. To simplify: need patching tool for linux servers
Screenshot related: tried spacewalk it sucked [img]http://img833.imageshack.us/img833/9291/54652339.png[/img]

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @chri5 chri5
item.description:
@chri5 wrote:

Just make a local APT repo, and use ClusterSSH?

Read full topic

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Bandwidth costs, period. Besides, it’s just wasteful over-all and slows down the entire network downloading the same package from the same server 200 times (if it doesn’t cost YOU, think about the poor sucker providing the package server). At the very least, you should set up a caching HTTP proxy like Squid to grab your packages through.

Read full topic

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @nade nade
item.description:
@nade wrote:

http://www.reddit.com/r/linuxquestions/comments/iosbr/enterprise_patching_solutions_spacewalk/

I guess I have to add more disk to the vm server. If I had a dollar for every time I botched a box by using volume manager I would have 2 dollars…

Read full topic

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Mopman:

Pooled? If not, then you’re paying decently for it. Regardless, the bandwidth is still costing you money, if you’re not able to burst then you’re paying $monthlyfee for 100 * seconds_in_month…

yeah but using it doesnt cost anything, you’re paying for potential

also theres a good chance its pooled for the entire building since none of the companies here use a lot of bandwidth, but i dunno

Read full topic

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

Mopman:

Well, I can assure you that bandwidth isn’t free. Methods of billing vary, but usually you have a set commit and then are billed 95th percentile on anything over that. It’s not a case of “have a line for x a month, do wtf you want with it”.

where i work they have unmetered transfer at 100 up/down

Read full topic

item.description:

But he doesn’t seem to want to mirror a repo… he’s deleted it now but the original post said something about lack of HD space and not wanting to download packages.
[/quote]

That will work fine too, he will just use a shitload of bandwidth downloading the same package 200 times, it would be much cheaper to put out $50 for a TB+ drive.[/quote]But… bandwidth doesnt cost money, its included in your monthly pay regardless of company or private person.

item.title: Enterprise Patching Solution
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

Do they all run the same OS and version? The same applications? If so, it’s pretty simple, mirror your own repo, point apt or whatever they have at it, and let it do it’s job.

Read full topic
